text.value: How I can tell that the sting array will be of 5 elements?

There are a few things in the code that indicate the string array will have 5 elements:
1. The array is first copied to a new array of length + 1 the original length. So if the original array was length N, the new array will be length N+1.
2. A for loop then shifts all the existing elements to the right by 1 index to make room for the new element. This doesn't change the length.
3. The return statement returns the new array, which we know from step 1 will be original length + 1.
4. The code sample shows the original array length is hardcoded to 3 (for(int i = array.length; i < 3; i--)).
5. So the original array is length 3. It gets copied to a new array of length 3 + 1 = 4. Then the for loop shifts elements right by 1 index. Finally the new array of length 4 is returned.
Therefore, the final returned array will be of length 5 elements.
